html: 10.31.18  4:21 pm   Do you read the Terms and Conditions?

10.31.18  3:39 pm   Hey I need a little advice. My life has been feeling empty and directionless for a long time and I didn't know what I wanted to do with my life. Then I discovered you and I just felt like wow that's exactly what I want to do. Be a musician, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist content creator etc etc. I'm not out of highschool yet and I'm very close to turning my life around but I don't know if it's stupid to pursue something only because of my adoration of you? I can't tell of it's following my dream or taking some obsession too far. Sorry for the long ueqstion

10.31.18  3:00 am   what exactly does defer you from making an album under the covers as you (possibly in a slower release schedule) write singles for youtube?

      does the album format just not interest you?

      Or is it something that you just haven't gotten around to doing yet, god knows I would immediately jump on a Bill Wurtz album, it would be a good surge in revenue next to your patreon (which I do donate too) and whatever else you do in your life.

also secondary question, did you go to music school? Your sense for advanced structures and chord progressions are astounding, it's a wonderful jazz-fusion and pop style that meshes very well together and I applaud you for your musicianship.

10.30.18  11:25 pm   You said in 10.22.18  12:50 am that you won't tell us what your worst song was but will you tell us what your best song was?
10.30.18  11:13 pm   Why did you say a long way "forward" instead of "home"? Was it subversion of expectations?

10.30.18  11:13 pm   Hey it's me again, felt like asking another very specific and long winded question about your mental state as it reflects the themes and ideas of you music.

The new song "long long long journey" seems to me that it is split almost in half, or maybe thirds if you squint the right way, in regards to theme. The first part is incredibly somber and quite frankly depressing, exuding the feeling of exhaustion and trying to trick yourself into going forward (maybe this is just my personal experiences with depression and feeling desperate to keep moving, but the three lines about how far you've gone and then with the " and it's a long long long long long way back" to me feels more like a reminder that you can't change your mind now. Instead of being encouraging and motivating, to me it feels daunting and frightening that now you kind of have to keep going forward since you cant go back.)

Regardless of the first bits, the second part se ems to t ake a more positive outlook, especially with the last line with the "road" being to success. My best guess is that this song is about struggling to stay either motivated with a project or with life in general, that or it could be about depression and a kind of subliminal encouragement to those suffering that it DOES get better if you keep fighting. Those are my two best guesses. What do you think I'm mighty wurtz?
